metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML Canvas Transformations
HTML Canvas Transformations
With transformations we can translate the origin to a different position, rotate and scale it.
content.html: With transformations we can translate the origin to a different position, rotate and scale it.

content.text: The six methods for transformations are:
content.html: The six methods for transformations are:

content.text: The translate() Method
The translate() method is used to move an object/element by x and y .
content.html: The translate() method is used to move an object/element by x and y.

content.text: The translate() method has the following parameters:
content.html: The translate() method has the following parameters:

content.code_html:
Parameter Description
x Distance to move in horizontal direction (left and right)
y Distance to move in vertical direction (up and down)

content.text: Assume one object is placed in position (10,10). Then, we use translate(70,70). The next object is also placed in position (10,10), but this means that the second object will be placed at x-position 80 (70 + 10) and at y-position 80 (70 + 10).
content.html: Assume one object is placed in position (10,10). Then, we use translate(70,70). The next object is also placed in position (10,10), but this means that the second object will be placed at x-position 80 (70 + 10) and at y-position 80 (70 + 10).

content.text: Let's look at some examples:
content.html: Let's look at some examples:

content.code:
<script>const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");ctx.fillStyle = "red";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 100, 50);ctx.translate(70, 70);
ctx.fillStyle = "blue";ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 100, 50);</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.fillStyle = "red";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 100, 50);

ctx.translate(70, 70);

ctx.fillStyle = "blue";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 100, 50);
</script>

content.code:
<script>const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");ctx.fillStyle = "red";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 100, 50);ctx.translate(70, 70);
ctx.fillStyle = "blue";ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 100, 50);
ctx.translate(80, -65);ctx.fillStyle = "yellow";ctx.fillRect(10,
10, 100, 50);</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.fillStyle = "red";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 100, 50);

ctx.translate(70, 70);

ctx.fillStyle = "blue";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 100, 50);

ctx.translate(80, -65);

ctx.fillStyle = "yellow";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 100, 50);
</script>

content.text: The rotate() Method
The rotate() method rotates a shape by an angle.
content.html: The rotate() method rotates a shape by an angle.

content.text: The rotate() method has the following parameter:
content.html: The rotate() method has the following parameter:

content.text: Tip: Angles are in radians, not degrees. Use (Math.PI/180)*degree to convert.
content.html: Tip: Angles are in radians, not degrees. Use (Math.PI/180)*degree to convert.

content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.rotate((Math.PI/180)*20);

ctx.fillStyle = "red";
ctx.fillRect(50, 10, 100, 50);
</script>

<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.rotate((Math.PI/180)*20);

ctx.fillStyle = "red";
ctx.fillRect(50, 10, 100, 50);

ctx.strokeStyle = "blue";
ctx.strokeRect(70, 30, 100, 50);
</script>

content.text: The scale() Method
The scale() method scales elements on the canvas up or down.
content.html: The scale() method scales elements on the canvas up or down.

content.text: The scale() method has the following parameters:
content.html: The scale() method has the following parameters:

content.code_html:
Parameter Description
x Horizontal scaling factor (the width)
y Vertical scaling factor (the height)

content.text: One unit on the canvas is one pixel. If we set the scaling factor to 2, one unit becomes two pixels, and shapes will be drawn twice as large. If we set a scaling factor to 0.5, one unit becomes 0.5 pixels, and shapes will be drawn at half size.
content.html: One unit on the canvas is one pixel. If we set the scaling factor to 2, one unit becomes two pixels, and shapes will be drawn twice as large. If we set a scaling factor to 0.5, one unit becomes 0.5 pixels, and shapes will be drawn at half size.

content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.strokeRect(5, 5, 25, 25);

ctx.scale(2, 2);

ctx.strokeStyle = "blue";
ctx.strokeRect(5, 5, 25, 25);
</script>

<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.strokeRect(15, 15, 25, 25);

ctx.scale(0.5, 0.5);

ctx.strokeStyle = "blue";
ctx.strokeRect(15, 15, 25, 25);
</script>

<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.strokeRect(5, 5, 25, 25);

ctx.scale(2, 3);

ctx.strokeStyle = "blue";
ctx.strokeRect(5, 5, 25, 25);
</script>

content.text: The transform() Method
The transform() method multiplies the current transformation with the matrix described by the arguments of this method. This lets you scale, rotate, translate (move), and skew the context.
content.html: The transform() method multiplies the current transformation with the matrix described by the arguments of this method. This lets you scale, rotate, translate (move), and skew the context.

content.text: The transform() method replaces the transformation matrix, and multiplies it with a matrix described by:
content.html: The transform() method replaces the transformation matrix, and multiplies it with a matrix described by:

content.text: a c e b d f 0 0 1
content.html:
a c e
b d f
0 0 1

content.text: The transform() method has the following parameters:
content.html: The transform() method has the following parameters:

content.code_html:
Parameter Description
a Horizontal scaling
b Horizontal skewing
c Vertically skewing
d Vertically scaling
e Horizontal moving
f Vertically moving

content.code:
<script>const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");ctx.fillStyle = "yellow";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 200, 100)ctx.transform(1, 0.5, -0.5, 1, 30, 10);
ctx.fillStyle = "red";ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 200, 100);
ctx.transform(1, 0.5, -0.5, 1, 30, 10);ctx.fillStyle = "blue";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 200, 100);</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.fillStyle = "yellow";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 200, 100)

ctx.transform(1, 0.5, -0.5, 1, 30, 10);

ctx.fillStyle = "red";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 200, 100);

ctx.transform(1, 0.5, -0.5, 1, 30, 10);

ctx.fillStyle = "blue";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 200, 100);
</script>

content.text: The resetTransform() Method
The resetTransform() method resets the current transformation to the identity matrix.
content.html: The resetTransform() method resets the current transformation to the identity matrix.

content.text: This is equal to calling: ctx.setTransform(1,0,0,1,0,0) .
content.html: This is equal to calling: ctx.setTransform(1,0,0,1,0,0).

content.text: The setTransform() Method

The setTransform() method resets the current transformation to the identity matrix, and then runs a transformation described by the arguments. This lets you scale, rotate, translate (move), and skew the context.
content.html: The setTransform() method resets the current transformation to the identity matrix, and then runs a transformation described by the arguments. This lets you scale, rotate, translate (move), and skew the context.

content.text: The setTransform() method has the following parameters:
content.html: The setTransform() method has the following parameters:

content.code_html:
Parameter Description
a Horizontal scaling
b Horizontal skewing
c Vertically skewing
d Vertically scaling
e Horizontal moving
f Vertically moving

content.code:
<script>const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");ctx.fillStyle = "yellow";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 200, 100)ctx.setTransform(1, 0.5, -0.5, 1, 30, 10);
ctx.fillStyle = "red";ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 200, 100);
ctx.setTransform(1, 0.5, -0.5, 1, 30, 10);ctx.fillStyle = "blue";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 200, 100);</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.fillStyle = "yellow";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 200, 100)

ctx.setTransform(1, 0.5, -0.5, 1, 30, 10);

ctx.fillStyle = "red";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 200, 100);

ctx.setTransform(1, 0.5, -0.5, 1, 30, 10);

ctx.fillStyle = "blue";
ctx.fillRect(10, 10, 200, 100);
</script>
